a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of children vaccinated against measles vs. against diphtheria,
Shown is the second-dose measles vaccination coverage of children against the DTP3 vaccination coverage of 12 to 23
month old children. The age at which children receive the second vaccination of measles varies between countries but is
typically between 15 months and 6 years old.
Data source: WHO, Global Health Observatory (2022)
